intro: Dortmanna sartorii, commonly known as the common dock, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Dortmanna sartorii is often found in moist soils along riverbanks, wet meadows, and other damp habitats. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically for its astringent and anti-inflammatory effects.
